page.title: 13STRAW BURNING_ADVANTAGES
page.content: In 1985{straw burning}is becoming a matter of{public concern. In this area of England straw has been burnt after harvest for 30 years. It is a quick, effective and inexpensive method of disposal and has several advantages for the farmer. Not least of these is speed_with the right weather a field can be burnt within an hour or so. An important factor now that so much of the cereal crop is{drilled}in the Autumn. Burning brings a considerable kill of weed seeds and reduces bacterial deseases helping to produce a 'clean' seed bed into which to drill the following crop. It is very economical because it needs very little labour to supervise the fire and little or{no extra {machinary}in the field and requires less{chemical sprays}to achive a good seed bed.
